intro: Pluchea sessifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved blueweed, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy on the underside. Its flowers are small, blue to purple, and clustered in spherical heads, which are attractive to pollinators. Pluchea sessifolia is often found in moist, open habitats such as fields and streambanks.
